title: Legal and Formal Register
description: Grammatical patterns characteristic of legal and highly formal discourse

sections.title: Legal Conditionals and Provisos
sections.explanation: Conditional structures used in contracts, regulations, and legal documents.

patterns.example: Subject to board approval, the merger will proceed as planned.
The license remains valid provided that all fees are paid annually.

patterns.pattern: In the event that / In the event of
patterns.example: In the event of termination, all rights revert to the licensor.
Unless otherwise specified, delivery will occur within 30 days.

sections.title: Shall and Legal Obligation
sections.explanation: The modal 'shall' in legal and regulatory contexts.

distinctions.example: The tenant shall maintain the premises in good condition.
The court may extend the deadline upon request.

distinctions.function: Strong obligation (but less formal than shall)
distinctions.example: All employees must complete the training.
distinctions.note: Common in policies, less in contracts

distinctions.example: Payments are to be made on the first of each month.

sections.title: Nominalization in Legal Language
sections.explanation: Converting verbs to nouns for formal, precise expression.

sections.title: Hereby, Herein, and Legal Deixis
sections.explanation: Formal deictic expressions pointing to elements within a document.

terms.example: The company hereby agrees to the terms set forth below.
The terms defined herein shall apply throughout the agreement.
Notwithstanding the above, the following exceptions apply.

exercises.original: The employee has to give two weeks notice before leaving.
exercises.answer: The employee shall provide two weeks' notice prior to termination of employment.

exercises.original: If the buyer fails to pay on time, the seller can cancel the contract.
exercises.answer: In the event of non-payment by the buyer, the seller may terminate the contract.

exercises.instruction: Complete with appropriate legal deictic expression
exercises.sentence: XYZ Ltd. (_____ referred to as 'the Supplier') agrees to the following terms.
